clearly these people have thought through where

we you will find out when we go to cook the rice

so now I want to talk a little bit more about 
all these different settings but first we have

to understand how rice cookers actually work so at 
the very basic level the only difference between

a pot and a rice cooker is a rice cooker knows 
when it's time to turn itself off and it knows

that by the fact that once the water runs out the 
bottom of the pot will get significantly hotter

and then with the temperature rises it goes up 
no more water in here let's turn off or switch

to keep warm mode whatever it decides to do now 
with a simple cooker like this that's all it does

now with the fancy cooker depending on the mode 
than you choose it will vary sort of the time in

the temperature that it uses to cook that rice 
so for example if you chose porridge obviously

it's not gonna wait until the water is gone to 
turn off because then you wouldn't have porridge

so probably it's just gonna go by time one very 
important thing to note about this machine is just

looking at the menu you kind of get the idea that 
this was created for Japanese rice was just short

grain rice these are lines for short grain white 
rice and short grain brown rice and short grain

so like none of these lines apply to long grain 
whether that's jasmine or basmati or any type of

long grain rice it does not apply so what you have 
to do if you do use long grain rice is you have to

actually measure the water it's it's annoying at 
first but it's not a huge deal because what you

do eventually is you just remember sort of where 
it falls closest to you'll discover oh it's pretty

close to the brown rice line a little bit less and 
then you'll just eyeball it from that point on and

you might be wondering what pre-washed rice is 
why is there a button for pre washed rice as you

want to touch on that pre washed rice is a type 
of Japanese rice that has been milled so this is

pretty washed rice right here it uses a different 
kind of technology to mill so that the end result

you end up with less of that starchy residue that 
you would normally have to wash off you can just

put the rice in the pot put the water press go 
it actually comes with a special rice measuring

cup specifically for pre washed rice which is

smaller than the regular cup is 171 milliliters
